resources.string: Andsens SQLite manager. Manage your Android databases
Number of lines to retrieve when paging data

Visit aSQLiteMagers's home page at: 
http://aaa.andsen.dk/aSQLiteManager.html 
To get a complete list of the functionality supported by aSQLiteManager. 

You can also send comments bug reports and feature requests to me at: 
android41cv@gmail.com 

Open databases form aSQLiteManager or from file managers 
List tables, views and indexes 
Database info 
Display data from tables and views 
Fields in the table viewer are colored based on the type of the field. As SQLite doesn't has field type validation the field type can differ from field type given with the create table statement 
Data editing and deleting form table browser from Edit label at each row 
Data entry add record from label on title at data browser 
Execute any SQL including 'Drop' / 'Create' statements 
Support for BLOB fields (except during editing) 
Support Begin transaction, Commit and Rollback 
Copy any cell to the clip board by pressing it 
Support table names and field names with spaces 
Store all executed statements in the opened database in a table called aSQLiteManager (by default turned off) 
Select SQL history from query form 
Export database to SQL script and restore databases from script 
Dump table from table view to file named Database.Table.sql - can be loaded by execute file as script 
Export of query results to ASCII file 
Execute SQL scripts, full script or single lines 
Remember recently opened databases for quick access to often used databases 
Use aShell (Beta) to edit system databases on rooted devices 

Martin
SQLite does not store auto index definitions
Must at least give a file name
You clicked on this SQLite database:
No of recently opened databases to save
sqlite_master is a read only system table
If your phone is rootet you can edit system databases with aSQLiteManager using aShell
You have now used aSQLiteManager in more than a week and at least 10 times. \nIf you like using it, please support it by a good rating. \nThanks for your support!
If you can reproduce this error please mail me the database and tell me how to provoke it ;-)

aSQLiteManager is a free open source SQLite manager / front end for Android devices. 

News in this version: 

Bug fixes 
Goto first / last page in the table viewer 
Simple filter option in the table viewer 
Main screen now always in portrait mode 

By using aShell (beta) you can edit all system databases on rooted phones with aSQLiteManager. You can find aShell here: 
http://market.android.com/search?q=pub:Andsen 
If you have problems with aShell please let me know. I only have access to a few devices so it is not possible for met to test the root functionality properly. 

For a description of all features check: 
aaa.andsen.dk/aSQLiteManager.html 

Comments, bug reports and feature requests are welcome. just drop me a mail at: 
android41cv@gmail.com 

And thanks to those of you who report bugs instead of complaining ;-) 

Hope you enjoy the app! 

Martin
